name: Subject 01 - Elena

sections.title: SUBJECT IDENTIFICATION
sections.text:
Name:           Elena
Designation:    Subject 01 (Control)
Blood Type:     Type-H (Synthetic)
DOB:            2112-06-01
Status:         VIABLE DONOR
Location:       Biocell-7 (Maintenance Wing)

sections.title: CONTROL SUBJECT PROTOCOL
sections.text:
Subject 01 designated as CONTROL for Project Heirloom.
Maintained in pristine condition while other subjects
underwent stress testing.

Purpose: Organ repository for high-value subjects.
All organs verified Type-H compatible.

NOTE: Control subject kept separate from general
      population to prevent contamination.

sections.title: CURRENT STATUS
sections.text:
Location:       Biocell-7, Maintenance Wing
Access:         Panel 7-C (Concealed)
Stasis:         ACTIVE (15 years)
Vitals:         STABLE
Organ Status:   OPTIMAL

Awaiting experimental treatment at time of
liquidation order. Cell entrance concealed
behind maintenance panel - missed by sweep team.

sections.title: LIQUIDATION REPORT EXCERPT
sections.text:
Sweep Team Lead: 'Building clear. All subjects
                  accounted for.'
QA:              'What about the biocell in
                  maintenance?'
Lead:            'What biocell? There's nothing
                  behind that panel.'
QA:              'Nevermind. Marking complete.'

sections.title: RECOVERY NOTES
sections.text:
Subject 01 remains viable for organ harvest.
Type-H blood makes her compatible with any
Heirloom subject.

Recommendation: Leave in stasis until needed.
                No maintenance required.

gmNotes: This document reveals Elena's location and purpose. It's clinical and cold - she's described as an 'organ repository'. The liquidation report excerpt shows how she was accidentally left behind.
